intro: Columnea longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed flame flower, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its trailing or upright growth habit. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow, often with contrasting white or yellow markings. Its foliage is typically glossy and elliptical, adding ornamental value to gardens and greenhouses. Columnea longipes thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
